assessment_title:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
PAdES is included in 2 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to the Netherlands, and Spain. The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement: The purpose of the specifications is not related to the publication of Open Data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

assessment_title:

PAdES Baseline Profile
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
ETSI’s standards-making process has been clearly defined after years of experience. The organisation has adopted the open approach which means direct participation and consensus as a basis to develop standards. All the stakeholders have the opportunity to participate directly in the process of standardisation through the technical committees created to develop ETSI’s technical specifications and standards. The decision-making process includes a public review, where stakeholders involved can provide technical feedback in order to enhance and maximize the quality and accuracy of the standards. 
See: 
https://www.etsi.org/standards/standards-making

PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
ETSI’s Intellectual Property Rights Policy is based on Standard Essential Patents (SEP). The policy implemented by the standardisation organisation seeks to reduce risks and ensure that the standards are available under (F) RAND basis and Royalty-free, it means with no cost or fee to be paid when possible. 

See: 
https://www.etsi.org/intellectual-property-rights

assessment_title:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification is sufficiently mature and has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
PAdES Baseline profile was published in 2013, this demonstrates the maturity of the specification and that it overcame its initital issues. Moreover, this profile of the PAdES Specification is an extension based on the regulation for the Internal Market Enhancing. 
Additionally, all ETSI’s standards and specifications are strictly related to market needs, which demonstrates market acceptance. Therefore, it is demonstrated that PAdES baseline profile has enough maturity and market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.

P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement: The specification is a key enabler of trusted connections and data exchange across borders, between administrations or business. The eSignature is method increasing lately thanks to its benefits reducing burdens. PAdES Baseline profile is involved in the electronic signature of PDFs documents, and as an asset to ease secure and trustworthy data exchange between parties it foster the creation of solutions, including innovative solutions.

P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification is independent from any specific technology and/or platform.
statement: PAdES is relying on PDF to verify and validate signed PDF format documents. Despite this fact, PDF is a widely adopted format for data exchange and this dependancy, thus it does not hamper its adoption.

assessment_title:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement: PAdES Baseline profile provides four levels of conformance that are linked with different types of documents and their functional requirements. Each level of conformance is defining a profile, these profiles are listed from less specificity to the maximum level. Therefore, the specification can be implemented according to the necessities of users without hampering interoperability.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement: PaDes fosters data portability by allowing electronically signed documents to be exchanged across borders and to be compatible with different systems.

assessment_title:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
PAdES Baseline profile is included in the Connect Europe Facility’s (CEF) eSignature Building Block which helps public administration and stakeholders to accelerate the creation and verification of electronic signatures. Moreover, it eases interoperability across borders avoiding users to provide information on different occasions. Additionally, there is a service (Digital Signature Service) offered by CEF which aims to help the creation and use of eSignature in the context of the European Internal Market. 

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/Services+eSignature

criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement: PAdES Baseline profile provides the main requirements to ensure the correct use and exchange of signed data in the context of the European Internal Market. Furthermore, the conformance levels included in this profile of PAdES have the objective of ensuring the trustworthy data exchange between public administrations and stakeholders.

PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The adoption of the standard or specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement: The specification is a key enabler for digital transactions across borders ensuring the trustworthiness of data being exchanged. This fact helps to avoid the non-digital data exchange allowing the reduction of administrative burden.

assessment_title:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement: The main purpose of PAdES baseline profile is not related to the preservation of digital information or items. Although, the different profiles defined by the specification are related to the long-term preservation of eSignatures and the materials related to the validation. This capability ensures the availability of signatures and related materials within a long period according to the needs of each implementer.

P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the standard or specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement: After carrying out a specific retrieval, no evidence has been found regarding already existing studies or documentation assessing PAdES Baseline Profile’s efficiency and effectiveness.

assessment_title:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification can be mapped to the EIRA.
statement:
PAdES Baseline Profile is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Specifically, PAdES Baseline Profile can define the interoperability aspects of “e-Seal Creation Service”, “e-Seal Verification and Validation Service”, “e-Signature Creation Service”, and “e-signature Verification and Validation Service” ABBs of the EIRA Technical View.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/distribution/eliscataloguev100betaxlsx

assessment_title:

PAdES Baseline Profile
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the standard or specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
ETSI has provided a conformance testing tool for electronic signatures according to the European Commission Mandate 460. The conformity testing tool involves different standards applied in the development of eSignatures, including PAdES, CAdES, XAdES, and ASiC. 

See:
https://signatures-conformance-checker.etsi.org/pub/PAdESConformanceTestChecker_v1.0.pdf
https://signatures-conformance-checker.etsi.org/pub/index.shtml

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification is recommended by a EU Member State.
statement:
5 Member States are recommending PAdES in their ICT National Catalogues. 
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

assessment_title:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been selected for its use in a EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
PAdES Baseline profile has been selected within the CEF Digital Signature Service (hereby DSS) along with CAdES, XAdES and ASiC. 

DSS is a free service that allows interested users to get started in the development of eSignatures according to existing regulations. The initiative is an enabler for the cross borders interoperability between administrations and business. 

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/Standards+and+specifications
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/DSS/webapp-demo/doc/dss-documentation.html

P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The specification is included in 5 Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications. Examples of Member States including PAdES in their catalogues are France or Spain.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
PAdEs and PAdES Baseline profile are included in the ETSI’s catalogue of standards. As ETSI is considered an official standardisation organisation, it can be considered that the specifications are included in a supra-national catalogue. 
See: 
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/103100_103199/103172/02.02.02_60/ts_103172v020202p.pdf
https://www.etsi.org/standards

assessment_title:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
In the context of eSignatures and Seals, the European Commission has stated an Implementing decision where urged the Member States and other Public services providers to recognise CAdES, PAdES, XAdES, and ASIC as formats for electronic signatures purposes. 

See: 
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX:32015D1506

P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
As one of the official European Organisation for standardisation, ETSI standards are compliant with the European Standardisation Regulation 1025/2012. 
See: 
https://www.etsi.org/about/etsi-in-europe

criterion_description: The standard or specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling standard or specification.
statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to business process modelling. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

PAdES Baseline Profile
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1:
Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI);
PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement: PAdES Baseline profile does not define a data model, but defines a set of conformance levels that have to be taken into account when creating electronic signatures applications over PDF format. Thus, PAdEs Baseline Profile is not defining a cross-sector reusable data model.

PAdES Baseline Profile
criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
PAdES and PAdES Baseline profile is referenced in the ETSI collection at the European Platform Joinup. Moreover, it can be found for free at ETSI’s webpage
See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/electronic-signatures-and-infrastructures-esi-pdf-advanced-electronic-signature-formats-pades-part-7
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/103100_103199/103172/02.02.02_60/ts_103172v020202p.pdf
